For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number Œ¥, the set {x : E | ‚à•x‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥ ‚à® x ‚àà s} equals the set {x : E | ‚à•x - o ‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥}, where o is the origin of E.

This theorem states that for every pair of natural numbers `m` and `n`, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `m` and `n` divides `n`. In mathematical notation, this can be written as: "For all m, n in ‚Ñï, gcd(m, n) ‚à£ n". This is a fundamental property of the gcd in number theory.

type: ‚àÄ (m n : ‚Ñï), m.gcd n ‚à£ n
name: Nat.gcd_dvd_right
docString: This theorem states that for every pair of natural numbers `m` and `n`, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `m` and `n` divides `n`. In mathematical notation, this can be written as: "For all m, n in ‚Ñï, gcd(m, n) ‚à£ n". This is a fundamental property of the gcd in number theory.

name: Multiset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a multiset

For a continuous function `f` on `[0,1]`, given `Œµ > 0`, `n > 0`, `x ‚àà [0,1]`, `k ‚àà [0,1]` not in `S` where `S = {k/n | k ‚àà ‚Ñï, |k/n - x| < Œ¥}`, and `Œ¥` is the modulus of continuity for `f` such that `|f(x) - f(y)| < Œµ/2` for `|x - y| < Œ¥`, the inequality `1 ‚â§ Œ¥¬≤ * (x - k/n)¬≤` holds.

type:
‚àÄ {f : C(‚ÜëunitInterval, ‚Ñù)} {Œµ : ‚Ñù} {h : 0 < Œµ} {n : ‚Ñï} {x : ‚ÜëunitInterval} {k : Fin (n + 1)},
  k ‚àà (bernsteinApproximation.S f Œµ h n x)·∂ú ‚Üí 1 ‚â§ bernsteinApproximation.Œ¥ f Œµ h ^ (-2) * (‚Üëx - ‚Üë(bernstein.z k)) ^ 2
name: bernsteinApproximation.le_of_mem_S_compl
docString: For a continuous function `f` on `[0,1]`, given `Œµ > 0`, `n > 0`, `x ‚àà [0,1]`, `k ‚àà [0,1]` not in `S` where `S = {k/n | k ‚àà ‚Ñï, |k/n - x| < Œ¥}`, and `Œ¥` is the modulus of continuity for `f` such that `|f(x) - f(y)| < Œµ/2` for `|x - y| < Œ¥`, the inequality `1 ‚â§ Œ¥¬≤ * (x - k/n)¬≤` holds.

This theorem states that for any natural number `n` and any unit `u` from the group of units of integers modulo `n` (denoted as `(ZMod n)À£`), the value of `u` (obtained using the `ZMod.val` function and then coercing `u` to integer) is coprime with `n`. In other words, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `ZMod.val ‚Üëu` and `n` is 1, meaning that they share no common factor other than 1.

type: ‚àÄ {n : ‚Ñï} (u : (ZMod n)À£), (‚Üëu).val.Coprime n
name: ZMod.val_coe_unit_coprime
docString: This theorem states that for any natural number `n` and any unit `u` from the group of units of integers modulo `n` (denoted as `(ZMod n)À£`), the value of `u` (obtained using the `ZMod.val` function and then coercing `u` to integer) is coprime with `n`. In other words, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `ZMod.val ‚Üëu` and `n` is 1, meaning that they share no common factor other than 1.
